name: Jose Hernandez
headline: Software Engineer at Oracle
blurb: I build scalable and robust solutions that helps data reach new heights.
bio:
Everyone knows about MySpace and its endless customization options through CSS. As a 9 year-old, I didn't know anything about CSS so I copy pasted some template from the internet. I then played with the CSS to get exactly what I wanted. After that, came YouTube and its customization. My explorations went everywhere throughout the years. But one things is for certain, since 2010, I would always go back to coding, even if it was for a single day.

I have ventured in web development, game development, mobile development, but the niche that I am best suited for is backend development.

I am a software engineer in the cloud by trade, but also like to do photography in my spare time, or torture myself by playing soulsborne games for hours on end.

experience.description: Improved DevOps experience for certain teams through the utilization of Oracle APEX and integration of various OCI Services.

Improved SEO ratings, accessibility score, and performance of the KFSCIS website through WordPress updates, as well as updating content for screen-reader accessibility. Additionally, implemnted an AI-Powered chatbot to aide the school's technical support team through frequently asked questions that the chatbot would answer.

Created an automated integration testing suite to improve the reliability of Kubernetes provider services for Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. This project aimed at improving the quality of production code pushed to production, as well as decrease debugging time, allowing members to focus on other tasks.
Developed a server cluster monitoring portal that allows users of the Oracle Roving Edge Infrastructure to view statistics and debug clusters of rented servers while deployed to the field.
